dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 3639 IH: Provide for the Common Defense Act of 2013
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bridenstine introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Budget, and in addition to the Committees on Ways and Means, Energy and Commerce, Agriculture, Oversight and Government Reform, and House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To eliminate sequestration for the security-related functions, to be offset through reductions in payments under Medicare, agricultural subsidies, federal retirement, and the application of chained CPI, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Provide for the Common Defense Act of 2013 .
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Title I—Elimination of sequestration for revised security category
Sec. 101. Elimination of 251A reductions for revised security category in fiscal years 2014 and 2015.
Sec. 201. Adjustments to calculation of Medicare part B and part D premiums for high-income beneficiaries.
Sec. 202. Increase in part B deductible for new enrollees.
Sec. 211. Cap on overall rate of return for crop insurance providers.
Sec. 212. Cap on reimbursements for administrative and operating expenses of crop insurance providers.
Sec. 213. Reduction in share of crop insurance premium paid by Federal Crop Insurance Corporation.
Sec. 223. Use of Chained Consumer Price Index.
Sec. 231. Change in index used to calculate Social Security cost-of-living adjustments.

title.header: Elimination of sequestration for revised security category

section.header: Elimination of 251A reductions for revised security category in fiscal years 2014 and 2015

subsection.header: Elimination of the adjustment under section 251A for fiscal years 2014 and 2015

paragraph.text: in paragraphs (7)(B) and (8), by striking On the date in each instance and inserting Subject to paragraph (12), on the date; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: No reductions for revised security category in fiscal years 2014 and 2015
paragraph.text: Paragraphs (7)(B) and (8) shall have no force or effect for fiscal years 2014 and 2015 with respect to the revised security category.

subsection.header: Discretionary spending limits for the revised security category in fiscal years 2014 and 2015
subsection.text: For purposes of section 251(c) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (as modified by section 251A(2) of such Act), for fiscal years 2014 and 2015, the discretionary spending limit for the revised security category in each such fiscal year shall be $552,000,000,000 and $566,000,000,000, respectively.

section.header: Adjustments to calculation of Medicare part B and part D premiums for high-income beneficiaries

subsection.header: Increase in applicable percentage used To calculate premiums

paragraph.text: by inserting after In general.— the following:
by adding at the end the following new subclause:

subclause.text: For calendar year 2017 and each subsequent calendar year:

row.entry: More than $85,000 but not more than $107,000
More than $107,000 but not more than $160,000
More than $160,000 but not more than $214,000

subsection.header: Temporary adjustment to income thresholds used To calculate premiums

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking In the case and inserting Subject to subparagraph (C), in the case; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Treatment of years after temporary adjustment period
subparagraph.text: In applying subparagraph (A) for the first year beginning after the period described in paragraph (6) and for each subsequent year, the 12-month period ending with August 2006 described in clause (ii) of such subparagraph shall be deemed to be the 12-month period ending with August of the last year of such period described in paragraph (6).

section.header: Increase in part B deductible for new enrollees

paragraph.text: in the first sentence of subsection (b), by inserting (subject to subsection (z)) after for a subsequent year; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: In the case of an individual who is not enrolled under this part before January 1, 2017, the amount of the deductible under subsection (b)—

paragraph.text: for 2017 shall be the amount otherwise determined under such subsection for 2017 increased by $25;
for 2018 shall be the amount otherwise determined under such subsection for 2018, taking into account the application of the previous paragraph;
for 2019 shall be the amount otherwise determined under such subsection for 2019, taking into the application of the previous paragraphs, , increased by $25;
for 2020 shall be the amount otherwise determined under such subsection for 2020, taking into account the application of the previous paragraphs, increased by $25;
for 2021 shall be the amount otherwise determined under such subsection for 2021, taking into account the application of the previous paragraphs, increased by $25; and

for any subsequent year shall be the amount otherwise determined under such subsection for such year, taking into account the application of the previous paragraphs and this paragraph for previous years.

section.header: Cap on overall rate of return for crop insurance providers

paragraph.text: by designating paragraph (3) as subparagraph (A) (and adjusting the margin two ems to the right);
by inserting before subparagraph (A) (as so designated) the following:
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Cap on overall rate of return
subparagraph.text: The target rate of return for all the companies combined for the 2014 and subsequent reinsurance years shall be 12.8 percent of retained premium.

section.header: Cap on reimbursements for administrative and operating expenses of crop insurance providers

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding subparagraphs (A) through (F), total reimbursements for administrative and operating costs for the 2014 insurance year for all types of policies and plans of insurance shall not exceed $935,000,000. For each subsequent insurance year, the dollar amount in effect pursuant to the preceding sentence shall be increased by the same inflation factor as established for the administrative and operating costs cap in the 2011 Standard Reinsurance Agreement.

section.header: Reduction in share of crop insurance premium paid by Federal Crop Insurance Corporation

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(i), by striking 67 and inserting 64;
in subparagraph (C)(i), by striking 64 and inserting 61;
in subparagraph (D)(i), by striking 59 and inserting 56; and
in subparagraph (E)(i), by striking 55 and inserting 52.
in subparagraph (A)(i), by striking 59 and inserting 56; and
in subparagraph (B)(i), by striking 55 and inserting 52.
in subparagraph (A)(i), by striking 59 and inserting 56;
in subparagraph (B)(i), by striking 55 and inserting 52; and
in subparagraph (C)(i), by striking 51 and inserting 48.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to the first contract change date for a contract under the Federal Crop Insurance Act occurring after the date of the enactment of this Act.

paragraph.text: Section 8334(c) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking (c) Each and inserting (c)(1) Each; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this subsection, the applicable percentage of basic pay under this subsection for civilian service by an employee or Member shall, for purposes of computing an amount—

subparagraph.text: for a period in calendar year 2014, be equal to the applicable percentage under this subsection for calendar year 2013 plus an additional 0.4 percentage point;
for a period in calendar year 2015, be equal to the applicable percentage under this subsection for calendar year 2014 (as determined under subparagraph (A)) plus an additional 0.4 percentage point;

for a period in calendar year 2016, be equal to the applicable percentage under this subsection for calendar year 2015 (as determined under subparagraph (B)) plus an additional 0.4 percentage point; and
for a period in any calendar year after 2016, be equal to the applicable percentage under this subsection for calendar year 2015 (as determined under subparagraph (C)).

Notwithstanding subsection (a)(2), any excess contributions under subsection (a)(1)(A) (including the portion of any deposit under this subsection allocable to excess contributions) shall, if made by an employee of the United States Postal Service or the Postal Regulatory Commission, be deposited to the credit of the Postal Service Fund under section 2003 of title 39, rather than the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund.

For purposes of this paragraph, the term excess contributions, as used with respect to contributions made under subsection (a)(1)(A) by an employee of the United States Postal Service or the Postal Regulatory Commission, means the amount by which—

clause.text: deductions from basic pay of such employee which are made under subsection (a)(1)(A), exceed
deductions from basic pay of such employee which would have been so made if paragraph (2) had not been enacted.

paragraph.text: Section 8334(a)(1)(B) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (i), by striking Except as provided in clause (ii), and inserting Except as provided in clause (ii) or (iii),; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: The amount to be contributed under clause (i) shall, with respect to a period in any year beginning after December 31, 2013, be equal to—

subclause.text: the amount which would otherwise apply under clause (i) with respect to such period, reduced by

the amount by which, with respect to such period, the withholding under subparagraph (A) exceeds the amount which would otherwise have been withheld from the basic pay of the employee or elected official involved under subparagraph (A) based on the percentage applicable under subsection (c) for calendar year 2013.

subsection.header: Individual contributions under the Federal Employees’ Retirement System
subsection.text: Section 8422(a)(3) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraph (B) as subparagraph (C); and
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following:

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this paragraph, the applicable percentage under this paragraph for civilian service by employees or Members other than revised annuity employees shall—

clause.text: for a period in calendar year 2014, be equal to the applicable percentage under this paragraph for calendar year 2013 plus an additional 0.4 percentage point;
for a period in calendar year 2015, be equal to the applicable percentage under this paragraph for calendar year 2014 (as determined under clause (i)) plus an additional 0.4 percentage point;
for a period in calendar year 2016, be equal to the applicable percentage under this paragraph for calendar year 2015 (as determined under clause (ii)) plus an additional 0.4 percentage point; and
for a period in any calendar year after 2016, be equal to the applicable percentage under this paragraph for calendar year 2016 (as determined under clause (iii)).

section.text: Section 8421(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking paragraph (3) and inserting paragraphs (3) and (4) ; and
by adding at the end the following:
No annuity supplement under this section shall be payable in the case of an individual who first becomes subject to this chapter after December 31, 2013.

section.header: Use of Chained Consumer Price Index

subsection.text: Paragraph (15) of section 8331 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: the term price index means the Chained Consumer Price Index (all items-all urban consumers) published monthly by the Bureau of Labor Statistics;

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect on January 1, 2015, and shall apply with respect to any cost-of-living adjustment taking effect under section 8340 or 8462 of title 5, United States Code, on or after that date.

section.header: Change in index used to calculate Social Security cost-of-living adjustments

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (G), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: the term Consumer Price Index means the Chained Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (C–CPI–U, as published in its initial version by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor).

paragraph.text: Section 215(i)(1) of the Social Security Act as in effect in December 1978, and as applied in certain cases under the provisions of such Act as in effect after December 1978, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

the term Consumer Price Index means the Chained Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (C–CPI–U, as published in its initial version by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor).

paragraph.text:
Section 215(i)(4) of the Social Security Act ( 42 U.S.C. 415(i)(4) ) is amended by inserting and by section 231 of the Provide for the Common Defense Act of 2013
after 1986.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to adjustments effective with or after December 2014.
